docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 6 (AP) -- Dr. Claude L. Fly, the United States agronomist released Tuesday after seven months captivity by Tupamaro guerrillas, has written an account of his ordeal, his son John disclosed today.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 6 (AP) -- Dr. Claude L. Fly, the United States agronomist released Tuesday after seven months captivity by Tupamaro guerrillas, has written an account of his ordeal, his son John disclosed today.
docs.abstract: son says Fly, during captivity, wrote 600-page diary, delivered by Tupamaros to Brit Hosp when they released him; Fly condition apparently improved; illus

headline.main: Fly Wrote a Diary While Captive
35 Countries to View Ali-Frazier Title Battle

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 2 -- Friends of Uruguay's President, Jorge Pacheco Areco, have opened a campaign to re-elect him to a new five-year term next November even though he is barred by the Constitution from succeeding himself.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 2 -- Friends of Uruguay's President, Jorge Pacheco Areco, have opened a campaign to re-elect him to a new five-year term next November even though he is barred by the Constitution from succeeding himself.
docs.abstract: Pres Pacheco's friends, headed by Sen Caputi, launch campaign for Const change that will allow him to be reelected to new 5-yr term in Nov; may force plebiscite, at same time as Pres election, if 10% of voters signatures are obtained before May 28; majority of Senators and Deputies seen opposing plan on grounds that principle of non-succession is vital to dem tradition; Pacheco has not publicly reacted to issue; illus of backers campaigning

headline.main: Uruguayans Ask Charter Change to Re-elect Chief

byline.original: By MALCOLM W. BROWNESpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 10 (AP) -- The Tupamaro guerrillas kidnapped Uruguay's attorney general today.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 10 (AP) -- The Tupamaro guerrillas kidnapped Uruguay's attorney general today.
docs.abstract: Tupamaros kidnap Atty Gen Berro from home, Montevideo; reptdly want him for questioning and will release him in few hrs

headline.main: Tupamaro Rebels In Uruguay Kidnap Attorney General

docs.snippet: PUNTA DEL ESTE, Uruguay, March 17 -- The United States mentioned a previously "unmentionable" topic at a special meeting here today of the Organization of American States -- the health and sanitary level of Latin-American exports.
docs.lead_paragraph: PUNTA DEL ESTE, Uruguay, March 17 -- The United States mentioned a previously "unmentionable" topic at a special meeting here today of the Organization of American States -- the health and sanitary level of Latin-American exports.
docs.abstract: US delegation headed by Asst Sec Meyer offers tech and other aid to make health and sanitary level of Latin Amer exports more acceptable to world mkts, OAS meeting; delegate recalls that subject of sanitary standards was previously only hinted at in delicate diplomatic chats and that discussions usually brought angry reaction from Latin Amer

headline.main: Export Sanitation Is Topic for O.A.S.; EXPORTS A TOPIC OF O. A. S. TALKS

keywords.value: AMERICAN NATIONS AND WESTERN HEMISPHERE POSSESSIONS

byline.original: By H. J. MAIDENBERGSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: After a bitterly disappointing season in which his team lost 20 of 25 games, Lou Rossini resigned yesterday as head basketball coach of New York University, ending a 13-year tenure. He had been under pressure from alumni distressed by N. Y. U.'s...
docs.lead_paragraph: After a bitterly disappointing season in which his team lost 20 of 25 games, Lou Rossini resigned yesterday as head basketball coach of New York University, ending a 13-year tenure. He had been under pressure from alumni distressed by N. Y. U.'s highest number of losses since the sport was instituted at the school in 1906.
docs.abstract: L Rossini resigns as NYU coach; team lost 20 of 25 games this season, highest number since sport was instituted there in '06

headline.main: Rossini Resigns as N.Y.U.'s Basketball Coach After Worst Season; VIOLETS DROPPED 20 OF 25 CONTESTS

docs.snippet: A growing number of Americans say they would like to emigrate to some other country if given the chance, according to the Gallup Poll.
docs.lead_paragraph: A growing number of Americans say they would like to emigrate to some other country if given the chance, according to the Gallup Poll.
docs.abstract: Gallup Poll finds 12% of Amers would like to emigrate to another country, 6% above '59 level; notes percentage is much higher among young adults with coll training; table shows percentage of citizens who would like to emigrate in US and 8 other nations and lists countries in which they would like to resettle

headline.main: GALLUP FINDS 12% WANT TO QUIT U.S.; Those FavoringEmigration Double Figure in '59

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, March 17 -- With a booming economy enhancing the dream of the building of a great industrial nation, Brazil has begun in the last two years to grow visibly into her vast territory, which is some 47 per cent of South America.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, March 17 -- With a booming economy enhancing the dream of the building of a great industrial nation, Brazil has begun in the last two years to grow visibly into her vast territory, which is some 47 per cent of South America.
docs.abstract: Booming econ discussed as enhancing Pres Medici's dream of bldg great indus nation and stirring wary interest of other Latin-Amer countries; dominant role in continent foreseen, emphasized by US withdrawal of missions in Latin Amer; illus

headline.main: Brazil's Neighbors Watching Warily the Sleeping Giant Stirs

byline.original: By JOSEPH NOVITSKISpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: PUNTA DEL ESTE, Uruguay, March 20 -- One week ago, on the 10th anniversary of the founding of the now moribund Alliance for Progress, delegates from the United States and 22 other Western Hemisphere countries gathered here to search for another...
docs.lead_paragraph: PUNTA DEL ESTE, Uruguay, March 20 -- One week ago, on the 10th anniversary of the founding of the now moribund Alliance for Progress, delegates from the United States and 22 other Western Hemisphere countries gathered here to search for another avenue toward regional cooperation.
docs.abstract: Delegates from US and 22 Western Hemisphere countries, meeting last wk on 10th anniv of now moribund Alliance for Progress, seen in agreement with US Sec Meyer, who noted that US Cong alone has power to admit or deny entry to Latin-Amer exports; observers cite mixed feelings about separation of region into distinct blocs; note US has special import arrangement with Mexico in exch for protection of US investments, while Brazil believes it has reached level of industrialization and tech sophistication equal to that of Mexico; say Brazil believes that its hospitality to foreign investments should be rewarded by greater access to US mkts; trade and tariff matters to be placed on agenda of forthcoming OAS meeting

headline.main: Trade Delegates of O.A.S. Mix Dissension and 'Togetherness'; FEELINGS MIXED AT O.A.S. PARLEY
